content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    output = ""

    # Split the markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Iterate over the lines and look for code blocks
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # If the line starts a code block
        if occursin(r"^\s*```julia", line)
            # Remember the start of the code block
            start_index = i
            # Look for the end of the code block
            while (i + 1 < length(lines)) && !occursin(r"```\s*$", lines[i + 1])
                i += 1
            end
            # If a valid code block is found
            if i > start_index + 1
                # Remove the code fences from the first and last line of the block
                code = replace(lines[start_index], r"^```julia\s*", "") * "\n" * replace(lines[i - 1], r"\s*```$", "")
                # Append the code to the output with newline characters removed from the end
                output *= replace(code, r"\n" => "") * "\n"
            end
        end
    end

    return output
end
```
